events.name: GA x NTUC: So You Want To Be A Developer
events.description:
Speakers:
Sayanee Basu (Singapore Power)
Akiko Naka (Founder & CEO, Wantedly)
Jordan Dea-Mattson (Vice President, Engineering, Carousell)

RSVP for free here: ga.co/2lKcAXu

Considering a career as a web developer? Curious about what a day-to-day job in web development looks like? Join General Assembly and NTUC to learn about what a day in the life entails for a web developer!

Hear from a panel of web developers as they tell all about their professional experience and see what it's like to work as one. We will explore different options for branching into web development and discuss how web developers are found and hired. We will also talk about the expectations you can have throughout your career and key areas of growth within the industry.

Join us and get acquainted with the field of web development in Singapore.

This session is moderated by Prima Aulia Gusta (Web Development Instructor, GA)

events.name: Olivier Prouvost - Eclipse meetup!
events.description:
Olivier is an Eclipse committer and travels the world to talk about the Eclipse ecosystem. == AbstractEclipse is not only an IDE for developing in Java. It is also an eco-system, managed by a Foundation and providing a lot of different projects that can help you to increase your productivity whatever the project and the programming language you use. This presentation will give you information about the Foundation, and the most important projects you should know for your software tooling or your projects. In particular, it will introduce the OSGi project and how it has been used to provide the powerful Eclipse 4 architecture (RCP). Then I will explain you how the Eclipse Modeling project can help to build your productivity tooling. Namely how you can create meta-models, editors for your models and code generators very easily using the EMF, XText, Xtend and Sirius projects. So if you are a standalone application developper or a web developper you will discover powerful projects that will help you every day for your future developments. 


== Schedule7 to 7.30PM - pizzas7.30 to 8.30 - talk 


== InfoOur apology for the last minute change. This meetup was firstly organised by Eclipse Singapore only.We have decided to let people register on the Java User Group as well so the process is simpler.
events.location: PayPal office in Suntec, 5 Temasek Blvd, #09-01 Suntec Tower Five, 038985 Nearest Mrt:Promenade(Yellow Line), Singapore

events.name: February Ruby Meetup
events.description:
<a></a> Hi fellow Rubyists!  Come join us for our February 2017 Ruby meetup at TradeGecko, 121 Telok Ayer St, Singapore 068590. -------------- Programme 1. Jin Hian from Mimetic.ai 2.  "Programming with Actor models in Ruby" - Alex Lawrence from Ruckus Wireless 3. "5 Random Ruby Tips" - Ted from TinkerBox studios 4. Announcements   - This is a 5 to 10-minute session, during which anyone can stand up and share something interesting! -------------- Interested to give a talk at future meetups? You could share about your startup technology stack, your new RubyGem, your opinions on best practices, or projects you discovered or are working on. And we are especially friendly towards beginners! See you all soon! --------------  Thank you Sponsors! Venue Sponsor  Food Sponsor  


Video Recording Many thanks to @engineersftw for video coverage!  


--------------  Organisers Winston  (@winstonyw / winstonyw@gmail.com)Mingding  (@hanmd82  / hanmd82@gmail.com)Guo Xiang (@tgx_world  / tgx_world@hotmail.com)

events.name: Attacker’s Perspective of Active Directory
events.description: This talk is a compilation of Red Team’s Tactics, Techniques and Procedures to fully compromise an Active Directory environment. The emphasis will be on post-exploitation techniques that attackers/red teamers have been abusing for years, however they were not well documented until recent years. Apart from offensive techniques, mitigation and detection methods will be covered as well. Thank you again to Akamai for their kind sponsorship of their office for our meetup. Speaker: Sunny NeoSunny Neo is a Penetration Tester with BT Security, Ethical Hacking Centre of Excellence, a global team that performs security testing for various industries. Besides his day job, he teaches Ethical Hacking at Temasek Polytechnic as an Adjunct Lecturer, and is one of the CREST Assessors in Singapore. He is certified with CCT APP, OSCE, OSCP and GXPN. He has 1 year plus of working experience.
events.location: Akamai Singapore office, 1 Raffles Place, #16-61, One Raffles Place Tower 2, Singapore 048616
